site.title: Temple University Libraries Digital Collections
site.description: Temple University Libraries offers free worldwide access to many of the unique primary historical and cultural resources held by the Libraries. These digital collections span Philadelphia history, African American culture, performing arts, university archives, and more.

collections.title: Allied Posters of World War I
collections.description: A striking collection of over 200 Allied propaganda posters from World War I, featuring recruitment appeals, war bond campaigns, and morale-boosting imagery from the United States, Great Britain, France, and other Allied nations. These posters reflect the visual persuasion techniques of the era and the social mobilization of the home front.

items.title: I Want You for U.S. Army
items.description: Iconic recruitment poster featuring Uncle Sam pointing directly at the viewer.

items.title: Remember Belgium
items.description: American propaganda poster urging enlistment by referencing the German invasion of Belgium.

items.title: Beat Back the Hun with Liberty Bonds
items.description: War bond poster depicting a menacing German soldier to encourage investment in Liberty Bonds.

collections.title: John W. Mosley Photographs
collections.description: Photographs by John W. Mosley documenting African American social life, community events, and cultural activities in Philadelphia from the 1930s through the 1960s. Mosley captured weddings, dances, civic gatherings, and everyday life, providing a rich visual record of the city's Black communities.

items.title: Cotillion Ball at the Bellevue-Stratford Hotel
items.description: Elegantly dressed attendees at a cotillion ball at the Bellevue-Stratford Hotel in Philadelphia.

items.title: Easter Promenade on South Street
items.description: African Americans dressed in Easter finery promenading along South Street in Philadelphia.

items.title: Musicians at a Jazz Club
items.description: Musicians performing at a Philadelphia jazz club, capturing the vibrant music scene.

collections.title: Philadelphia Dance Collection
collections.description: Photographs documenting Philadelphia's rich dance heritage, featuring the Pennsylvania Ballet and the Philadelphia Dance Company (Philadanco). The collection spans from the 1960s through the 1990s, capturing performances, rehearsals, and the individual artistry of dancers.

items.title: Sleeping Beauty
items.description: Pennsylvania Ballet dancers performing Sleeping Beauty, one of the company's early productions.

items.title: Rodeo
items.description: Pennsylvania Ballet company members in Agnes de Mille's Rodeo, performed at the Merriam Theatre.

items.title: David St. Charles - Lead Male Dancer
items.description: David St. Charles, Philadanco's lead male dancer, photographed at the company's West Philadelphia location.

collections.title: Frank G. Zahn Railroad Photograph Collection
collections.description: Photographs of railroads and trains taken by Frank G. Zahn, documenting American railroading from the steam era through the transition to diesel locomotives. The collection includes images of stations, rolling stock, locomotives, and railroad infrastructure across the eastern United States.

items.title: Pennsylvania Railroad Locomotive
items.description: A Pennsylvania Railroad steam locomotive at a station, showcasing the engineering of the steam era.

items.title: Reading Railroad Freight Train
items.description: A Reading Railroad freight train moving through the Pennsylvania countryside.

items.title: 30th Street Station
items.description: Philadelphia's 30th Street Station, a major hub of the Pennsylvania Railroad system.

collections.title: City Parks Association Photographs
collections.description: Photographs from the City Parks Association of Philadelphia documenting the city's parks, playgrounds, and recreational spaces from the late 19th and early 20th centuries. The images reveal the development of urban green spaces and their role in community life.

items.title: Fairmount Park Scenery
items.description: A scenic view of Fairmount Park, Philadelphia's largest public green space.

items.title: Children at a City Playground
items.description: Children playing at a city playground, part of the movement to create recreational spaces in urban areas.

items.title: Park Fountain and Visitors
items.description: Visitors enjoying a park fountain on a warm day in early 20th-century Philadelphia.

collections.title: NAACP, Philadelphia Branch Photographs
collections.description: Photographs from the Philadelphia branch of the National Association for the Advancement of Colored People (NAACP), documenting civil rights activities, community organizing, and leadership in Philadelphia throughout the 20th century.

items.title: NAACP Annual Banquet
items.description: Attendees at the Philadelphia NAACP's annual banquet, a major community event bringing together civic leaders.

items.title: Civil Rights March in Philadelphia
items.description: Participants in a civil rights march through Philadelphia, organized by the local NAACP branch.

items.title: Community Meeting
items.description: A community meeting organized by the Philadelphia NAACP to discuss local civil rights issues.

collections.title: Temple Sheet Music Collections
collections.description: A diverse collection of American sheet music spanning the 19th and early 20th centuries, featuring popular songs, patriotic music, ragtime, and parlor songs. The illustrated covers provide a vivid visual record of American popular culture, social attitudes, and graphic design.

items.title: After the Ball
items.description: Sheet music for 'After the Ball,' one of the most successful popular songs of the 19th century.

items.title: The Stars and Stripes Forever
items.description: Sheet music cover for John Philip Sousa's iconic march, The Stars and Stripes Forever.

items.title: Maple Leaf Rag
items.description: Scott Joplin's Maple Leaf Rag, a foundational work of ragtime music.

collections.title: Paul Robeson Collection
collections.description: Materials documenting the life and career of Paul Robeson, the renowned singer, actor, athlete, and civil rights activist. The collection includes photographs, programs, correspondence, and ephemera spanning Robeson's remarkable career from the stage to the political arena.

items.title: Paul Robeson in Othello
items.description: Paul Robeson in his acclaimed role as Othello, one of the most celebrated performances in American theater history.

items.title: Concert Program
items.description: Program from a Paul Robeson concert, showcasing his celebrated bass-baritone voice.

items.title: Robeson at a Rally
items.description: Paul Robeson speaking at a rally, reflecting his lifelong commitment to social justice and civil rights.

collections.title: Blockson Afro-American Collection Photographs
collections.description: Photographs from the Charles L. Blockson Afro-American Collection, one of the nation's leading research facilities for the study of the history and culture of people of African descent. The collection documents African American life, achievements, and history from the colonial era to the present.

items.title: Portrait of Frederick Douglass
items.description: A portrait from the Blockson Collection documenting prominent African American figures.

items.title: African American Military Service
items.description: Photograph documenting African American military service, part of the Blockson Collection's records.

items.title: Community Gathering
items.description: A community gathering captured in the Blockson Collection, documenting the richness of African American social life.

collections.title: Temple History in Photographs
collections.description: Photographs documenting the history of Temple University from its founding by Russell Conwell in 1884 to the present day. The collection includes images of campus buildings, student life, athletics, commencement ceremonies, and notable figures in the university's history.

items.title: Russell Conwell, Founder of Temple University
items.description: Portrait of Russell Conwell, who founded Temple University in 1884 with the mission of providing accessible education.

items.title: Early Campus Buildings
items.description: Early buildings on the Temple University campus in North Philadelphia.

items.title: Commencement Ceremony
items.description: A Temple University commencement ceremony, marking the achievements of graduating students.
